Patient 21: Patient 21 is a 55-year-old female with a history of type 2 diabetes and hypertension. Her current medication regimen includes metformin, lisinopril, and atorvastatin. She has a family history of cardiovascular disease, with her father having suffered a myocardial infarction at age 60. She is allergic to penicillin, which causes a rash. Her medication list has remained stable for the past year, with no recent changes or adjustments.
